english: upside-down ritual axe perhaps made of precious materials

etymology.description: Depicts an upside-down ritual axe -> later meaning soldier -> eventually officer or intellectual
etymology.interpretation: The character 士(士) (shì, 'officer') originally depicted a ritual axe, symbolizing authority and power. Over time, it evolved to signify roles associated with leadership and scholarship.

examples.chinese: 博物馆今日展出了士(士)，展示古代祭祀器物(展示古代祭祀器物)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn jīnrì zhǎnchūle shì(士)，zhǎnshì gǔdài jìsì qìwù(展示古代祭祀器物)。
examples.english: The museum exhibited the shì today, showcasing ancient sacrificial vessels.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在遗址中发现了一把士(士)，被认为是祭祀用的珍贵器物(被認為是祭祀用的珍貴器物)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài yízhǐ zhōng fāxiànle yī bǎ shì(士)，bèi rènwéi shì jìsì yòng de zhēnguì qìwù(被認為是祭祀用的珍貴器物)。
examples.english: Archaeologists discovered a shì at the site, which is considered a precious ritual artifact.

examples.chinese: 工匠精心打造出的士(士)，在阳光下闪烁着金属光芒(在陽光下閃爍着金屬光芒)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiàng jīngxīn dǎzàochū de shì(士)，zài yángguāng xià shǎnshuò zhe jīnshǔ guāngmáng(在陽光下閃爍着金屬光芒)。
examples.english: The shì, crafted meticulously by artisans, shimmers under the sunlight with a metallic glow.
